Your location is needed to be able to use this app correctly!
Access to your location is important when it comes to showing you nearby locations you can visit.
Please login below. If you do not have an Admin account you cannot login.
Take a Virtual Selfie with a Landmark

This app uses GPS to determine your current location and helps locate nearby sites that are supported. To allow Location Services navigate to Settings and ensure the Location Permissions toggle is switched on (green). Location Services will be required to view your location on any maps that are implemented throughout the app. The Nearby Locations tab will order the sites from nearest to your current location as well.

This app also uses your front and rear cameras. To allow camera permissions navigate to Settings and turn on the Camera Permissions toggle. The camera is used throughout the application to view 3D models and popups using Augmented Reality. You will not be able to see or use these features if it does not have access to the camera.

To ensure that the Augmented Reality features of the app work, you must be using an Android device that is running Android Version 7.0 or higher. This can also be referred to as Android Nougat. To check if you are running the required software version, navigate to the Settings app on your phone. Click on System >> About and then look for "Android version". It should display a number. If it is 7 or above then your phone can support Augmented Reality.

To ensure your phone supports AR Core (for Augmented Reality), please check the following list for your phone >> https://developers.google.com/ar/discover/supported-devices. The app should recognise and inform you automatically if your phone is not supported, but just in-case you want to check manually you may do so here.
